__e: You will come to me at my house to explain your betrayal of my faith in you.
It's hard dealing with her father's death and betrayal.
Be it betrayal by my hands or by my heart, I am guilty.
Yes, that's right. My good fellow, I could not think of such deception to the fair sex.
What is the price for betraying those you should have held most dear?
That is the greatest betrayal of those who died in the war. It is your betrayal.
So... it's a tale of betrayal and revenge.
You talk about betrayal and people hurting you and then you do it in spades.
He mentioned you and Varus and talked of betrayal.
What you have done to me goes so far beyond betrayal, that thinking of a way of getting even hasn't been easy. But, you know, I think I may have it now.
That would be murder, not to mention treason, and that's not who we are.
I can't stop now, you see, because that's treason, and you know what that means for the guilty.
Hey! This is just like "Double-cross at Dead Man's Ditch,"
You're going down, and you're going down hard for treason, unless you start talking!
No, except the betrayal of a king, perhaps.
It just doesn't sound like treason to me.
There's anything outside of treason to do?
See, I think that was a betrayal that you just... you couldn't live with.
The bottom line is, betrayal's in your nature.
So you see... I'm not the only one dealing with betrayal.
The heartbreak may be old, but the betrayal, that is brand-new.
